member.name: T:HighScore.HS
member.summary: Class used to submit potential high scores

member.name: M:HighScore.HS.SubmitHighScore(UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this method to submit a score to the server. The server will check to see if this is a high score or not, so just submit the user's score using this method regardless if this is a top tier score or not.
member.param: Use the 'this' pointer for this. This is so I can call StartCoroutine to make a web request
Name as the player would like it to appear on the scoreboard

member.name: M:HighScore.HS.Init(UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour,System.String)
member.summary: Call this when the game starts up. This will make sure your team's game is registered and will register it if not. Make SURE that the name of the game is exactly the same every time this function is called. Changing it will create a new game and I'll have to manually remove the old one. Call this method only once but call it every time game starts.
member.param: Use the 'this' pointer for this. This is so I can call StartCoroutine to make a web request
Name of the game as you want it to appear on the high score table
